shippingorder

Interface IShippingOrder


  • public interface IShippingOrder

    Escola Superior de Tecnologia e Gestão (ESTG)
    Politécnico do Porto (PP)
    Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática (LEI)
    Licenciatura em Segurança Informática em Redes de Computadores (LSIRC)
    Paradigmas de Programação (PP)
    2019 / 2020

    Contract representing the Shipping order behaviour. This class stores an immutable collection of containers

    Authors:

    • @author Ricardo Santos
    • @author Bruno Oliveira
    • @author Fábio Silva
    • @author João Ramos
    • @author Óscar Oliveira

    • Method Detail

      • addContainer

        boolean addContainer(IContainer container)
              throws OrderException,
                     ContainerException
        Adds a new container to the shipping order
        Parameters:
        container - container to be added
        Returns:
        1. true if the container is inserted in the shipping order.
        2. false if the container already existsContainer in the shipping order
        Throws:
        OrderException - if the shipping order status is not equal to IN_TREATMENT
        ContainerException - if:
        1. any parameter is null
        2. the container is not closed

      • removeContainer

        boolean removeContainer(IContainer container)
                 throws OrderException,
                        ContainerException
        Removes a container from the shipping order
        Parameters:
        container - container to be removed
        Returns:
        1. true if the container is removed in the shipping order.
        2. false if the container doesn't exists in the shipping order.
        Throws:
        OrderException - if the status is not IN_TREATMENT
        ContainerException - if the parameter is null

      • existsContainer

        boolean existsContainer(IContainer container)
        Checks if the container exists in the shipping order
        Parameters:
        container - to check existence
        Returns:
        true if the container exists in the shipping order false if the container does not exists in the shipping order

      • findContainer

        int findContainer(java.lang.String reference)
        Searches for a given container based on its reference
        Parameters:
        reference - to find container
        Returns:
        the index number that refers to the position occupied by the container in the shipping order list

      • getStatus

        OrderStatus getStatus()
        Getter for order status
        Returns:
        order status

      • setStatus

        void setStatus(OrderStatus status)
        throws OrderException,
               ContainerException,
               PositionException
        Setter for status. A specific order for status should be preserved:
        1. if the @param status is IN_TREATMENT then the status should be: AWAITS_TREATMENT
        2. if the @param status is CLOSED then the status should be: IN_TREATMENT and the number of containers in the shipping order should be greater than 0. Additionally, to close the shipping order, the shipping order should be validated
        3. if the @param status is SHIPPED then the order status should be: closed
        Parameters:
        status - represents the order status to change the status
        Throws:
        OrderException - if the current status is not compatible with the status @param status to change
        ContainerException - if the volume greater than the current volume (when shipping order is validated)
        PositionException - if some item is outside (or is overflowing) the container or if some item is overlapping with other item (when shipping order is validated)

      • getId

        int getId()
        Getter for shipping order unique identifier
        Returns:
        shipping order unique identifier

      • getContainers

        IContainer[] getContainers()
        Returns an array (without null positions) for the containers in the shipping order
        Returns:
        an array (without null positions) for the containers in the shipping order

      • validate

        void validate()
       throws ContainerException,
              PositionException
        Checks if any container is invalid
        Throws:
        ContainerException - if the volume greater than the current volume
        PositionException - if some item is outside (or is overflowing) the container or if some item is overlapping with other item

      • summary

        java.lang.String summary()
        Returns a string representation with a summary of the existing containers and their items
        Returns:
        a string representation with a summary of the existing containers and their items
